intro: Irvingia harmandiana, commonly known as the African mango, is a tropical tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Irvingiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elongated, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into edible, fleshy fruits. The fruit contains a single seed surrounded by a white, aromatic pulp. Irvingia harmandiana is valued for its potential nutritional and medicinal properties.
